sen.e: The seventeen-year old Tadamasa, who was staying at Edo-jo Castle on duty, did not let Yorinobu in the gate and told him: the security is tight due to emergency and therefore it is impossible to let you in: please negotiate with roju.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The seventeen-year old Tadamasa, who was staying at Edo-jo Castle on duty, did not let Yorinobu in the gate and told him: the security is tight due to emergency and therefore it is impossible to let you in: please negotiate with roju.

Seventeen-year-old Tadamasa, staying at Edo-jo Castle on duty, did not let Yorinobu in the gate and told him "Security is tight due to an emergency, therefore I can not let you in. Please talk with the shogun's council of elders."
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 頼宣は早速、酒井忠清と対面したが、城内に別条なければ御登城に及ばずと伝え、頼宣はその場を退いたという。
sen.e: Yorinobu immediately met Tadakiyo SAKAI but he said: if the castle is no danger, I do not need to come in, and then he left the place.
Yorinobu immediately met Tadakiyo SAKAI but he said: if the castle is no danger, I do not need to come in, and then he left the place.
Yorinobu immediately met Tadakiyo SAKAI, told him "If the castle is in no danger, I do not need to come in" and left the place.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 酒井忠清はこの折の忠昌の対応を感じ入ったといい、その模様が次の様に記録されている。
sen.e: Tadakiyo SAKAI was impressed with Tadamasa's judgment; the situation was recorded as follows:
Tadakiyo SAKAI was impressed with Tadamasa's judgment; the situation was recorded as follows:

sen.j: 「若年にて警固の心得丈夫なるを称して、背中をほとほと打ければ、著込みを著用して居たり。
sen.e: "When I patted Tadamasa on the back, saying that: you are young, but you have a good sense of what it means to guard, I notice that he was wearing protective clothing.
"When I patted Tadamasa on the back, saying that: you are young, but you have a good sense of what it means to guard, I notice that he was wearing protective clothing.
When I patted Tadamasa on the back, saying "You are young, but have good understanding of guarding", I noticed that he was wearing a protective vest.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 忠清手を拍て、益々感じ、格別の器量驚入りぬとて帰りけり」とある。
sen.e: Clapping his hands, Tadakiyo was further impressed with and surprised at Tadamasa's outstanding capability, and went back."
Clapping his hands, Tadakiyo was further impressed with and surprised at Tadamasa's outstanding capability, and went back."
Tadakiyo clapped his hands, further impressed with and surprised at Tadamasa's outstanding capability, and went back.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 忠清はこのことを同僚に述べ、賛辞を止めなかったという。
sen.e: Tadakiyo talked about this to his colleagues and never stopped praising Tadamasa.
Tadakiyo talked about this to his colleagues and never stopped praising Tadamasa.
Tadakiyo talked about this to his colleagues, never stopped praising Tadamasa.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: それ以前は忠清は忠昌と特段親しいわけではなかったが、この形容に感じて、常に賞賛したという。
sen.e: Although Tadakiyo was not particularly close with Tadamasa before that, he was impressed with his appearance and always praised Tadamasa.
Although Tadakiyo was not particularly close with Tadamasa before that, he was impressed with his appearance and always praised Tadamasa.

sen.j: よって、肥後国天草藩主に欠員が出た折は、幕閣の間にて天草に置くべき人は忠昌を越える者なしと決せられた。
sen.e: When the position for the lord of Amakusa Domain of the Higo Province became vaccant, the cabinet officials of the Shogunate concluded that no other person was more qualified than Tadamasa to be appointed as the lord of Amakusa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

When the position for the lord of Amakusa Domain of the Higo Province became vaccant, the cabinet officials of the Shogunate concluded that no other person was more qualified than Tadamasa for the lord of Amakusa.

sen.j: 忠昌は天草藩主に転ずることになったという。
sen.e: Accordingly, Tadamasa was transferred to become lord of the Amakusa Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 忠昌老年の折、孫婿に酒井忠真なる者がいた。
sen.e: When Tadamasa was in his old-age, he had a grandson-in-law Tadazane SAKAI.
When Tadamasa was in his old-age, he had a grandson-in-law Tadazane SAKAI.
When Tadamasa was in his old age, he had a grandson-in-law Tadazane SAKAI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 忠真が幼年の為、親族の松平信興（原文では誤って「信奥」となっている）が後見し、藩の重要事項は忠昌が携わった。
sen.e: As Tadazane was young, his relative Nobuoki MATSUDAIRA ("Nobuoku" in the original document as a typographical error) acted as guardian and Tadamasa handled the important issues of the domain.
As Tadazane was young, his relative Nobuoki MATSUDAIRA ("Nobuoku" in the original document as a typographical error) acted as guardian and Tadamasa handled the important issues of the domain.
As Tadazane was young, his relative Nobuoki MATSUDAIRA ('Nobuoku' in the original document as a typographical error) acted as guardian, and Tadamasa handled the important issues of the domain.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 貞享の折、ある時酒井家に1,000石を領す家臣がいたが、その嫡男は不出来の人で家督とするには心もとなく、廃嫡してもその他に息子もいなかった。
sen.e: During the Jokyo era, Sakai family had a vassal who possessed 1,000 koku; his legitimate son did not possess enough merit to become head of the family, and even if he was disinherited, the vassal did not have any other son.

During the Jokyo era, Sakai family had a vassal who possessed 1,000 koku; his legitimate son did not possess enough merit to become head of the family, and even if he was disinherited, the vassal did not have any other son.

During the Jokyo era, Sakai family had a vassal who possessed 1,000 koku but whose legitimate son did not possess enough merit to become head of the family, and what is worse, the vassal did not have any other son to disinherit the son.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、親族のうちに優秀なる甥がいるのでこの者を養子としたいと思ったが、その家臣は特段養子縁組の手続きもなすことなく、急に亡くなったという。
sen.e: However, the vassal thought that he wanted to adopt his exemplary nephew from among his relatives; however, he suddenly died without specifically proceeding with the adoption.
However, the vassal thought that he wanted to adopt his exemplary nephew from among his relatives; however, he suddenly died without specifically proceeding with the adoption.
Then, the vassal thought that he wanted to adopt his exemplary nephew from among his relatives, but he suddenly died without specifically proceeding with the adoption.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 酒井家ではその者の相続の儀如何にしようかと考えあぐねて、故人の嫡男とその甥に500石ずつ分知してはどうかと相計り、後見の松平信興に相談した。
sen.e: The Sakai family tried to figure out who should be the heir to the vassal and assumed that the legitimate son and nephew of the deceased might receive 500 koku each, and then consulted with the guardian Nobuoki MATSUDAIRA.

The Sakai family tried to figure out who should be the heir to the vassal and assumed that the legitimate son and nephew of the deceased might receive 500 koku each, and then consulted with the guardian Nobuoki MATSUDAIRA.

The Sakai family tried to figure out who should be the heir to the vassal, assumed that the legitimate son and nephew of the deceased might receive 500 koku each, and then consulted with the guardian Nobuoki MATSUDAIRA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 信興もまた、その嫡男が不出来であれば皆々が申す通りその案は尤もであるが、重い決定であれば忠昌に相談した方が良いと申したといった。
sen.e: Nobuoki said: if the legitimate son is not an able person, the idea is as all of you said, but if it is an important decision, you'd better consult with Tadamasa.
Nobuoki said: if the legitimate son is not an able person, the idea is as all of you said, but if it is an important decision, you'd better consult with Tadamasa.
Nobuoki said "If the legitimate son is not an able person, my idea is the same as all of you have said, but as it is an important decision, you'd better consult with Tadamasa."
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これにより、この酒井家では、家臣の家督相続の儀を忠昌に相談したが、忠昌は酒井家代々の作法もあろうこと故に何事も申しがたい。
sen.e: Accordingly, the Sakai family consulted with Tadamasa about the heir to the head of the vassal; Tadamasa said that he could not say anything about it considering successive manners of the Sakai family:

Then, the Sakai family asked Tadamasa's opinion about the inheritance of their vassel, only to receive the Tadamasa's reply "I am not in a position to advise on that matter, as the Sakai family has its own traditional manners."
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。Vessel→vassel

sen.j: 幕府のことであれば何事でも申し述べようがと言ったという。
sen.e: If it was a governmental affair, I could have said something.
If it was a governmental affair, I could have said something.

sen.j: 酒井家の者は、重ねてかつてこの様なことで知行を減じたことはないが嫡男と甥で分けてはどうかと相談したく、酒井家の家臣はご相談せんと罷り越した次第であると伝えた。
sen.e: A member of the Sakai family once again said that the family had never reduced the enfeoffment in such a manner, but the vassals of the Sakai family wanted to consult with Tadamasa about dividing up the enfeoffment between the legitimate son and nephew.

A member of the Sakai family once again said that the family had never reduced the enfeoffment in such a manner, and wanted to consult with Tadamasa about dividing up the enfeoffment between the legitimate son and nephew.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、忠昌は小身の者でも家督のことは重きことなれば善悪とも申し難いと述べたという。
sen.e: However, Tadamasa said that even in the case of a person of low rank, the issue of the head was important and therefore, it was difficult to say good or bad.

Tadamasa replied that "Inheritance is quite an important matter even if the successors are children. That is why I refuse to say anything on that matter."
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 酒井家の者はこれを信興に伝えると、忠昌がその様に申すのは意味があってのことだろうから、伺って仔細を尋ねてみようと言った。
sen.e: When a member of the Sakai family mentioned this to Nobuoki, he said that Tadamasa must have had some intention in saying so and thus should ask him for details.

When a member of the Sakai family mentioned this to Nobuoki, he said "Tadamasa must have had some intention in saying so, and thus, I should ask him for details."

sen.j: 信興と酒井家の家臣は再び忠昌の下に参じてこの談を議したところ、重ねてたずねられることではあるので忠昌も見解を述べたという。

sen.j: 忠昌が申すには、故人は藩主の忠真が幼い折より使えた大功の老臣であるが、故人の嫡子不出来である故、甥であれば藩のお役に立つとのことで、それぞれ500石ずつ与えるというのは尤もとは言い難い。
sen.e: Tadamasa said: "the deceased vassal was the main retainer who served the lord Tadazane since he was young and rendered distinguished services to the lord; however, it is not a good idea to give 500 koku each for the vassal's legitimate son and the nephew even if the legitimate son is incapable while the nephew is able to help the clan.

Tadamasa said "the deceased vassal was the main retainer who served the lord Tadazane since the lord was young and rendered distinguished services; however, it is not a good idea to give 500 koku for each of the vassal's legitimate son and the nephew, even if the legitimate son is incapable while the nephew is able to help the clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 父の知行をすべて子に与えてこそ、その功労に報いることにはならないだろうか。
sen.e: I believe that a son could repay his father's contribution only by succeeding all of a father's enfeoffments.

sen.j: 故人が甥に継がせたいというのは、まこと以って忠臣というべきではある。
sen.e: It is unquestionable that the retainer was loyal, since he was willing to have his newphew succeed.

We should say that the vassal is unquestionably loyal, as he was willing to have his newphew his successor.

sen.j: しかし、生前に子を廃嫡し、甥に家督相続の儀を届け出ているのであれば、故人の意思を尊重するのに何の躊躇もないが、そうした手続きもなくすべては死後のことであれば、実子に俸禄のすべてを相続させて、その甥には小知でも与えたらどうかという沙汰を伝えた。
sen.e: If he reported before died that his son would be disinherited and his nephew would succeed the head, I would never hesitate to respect the will of the deceased; however, when the vassal is already dead without any procedure, a biological son should succeed all salaries and why don't you give his nephew superficial knowledge."

If he reported before he died that his son would be disinherited and his nephew would succeed him, I would never hesitate to respect the will of the deceased; however, when the vassal dies without any procedure, a biological son should succeed all salaries and why don't you give his nephew a little allowance."

sen.j: これを聞いた者は皆感心し、その通りの沙汰を下したという。
sen.e: Those who heard this were impressed and handled the issue as dictated by Tadamasa.
